member.name: REQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_BUFFER
member.summary: Contains the opportunistic lock (oplock) information returned by theFSCTL_REQUEST_OPLOCK control code.

member.name: REQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_BUFFER.StructureVersion
member.summary: The version of theREQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_BUFFER structure that is being used.

member.name: REQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_BUFFER.StructureLength
member.summary: The length of this structure, in bytes.

summary.para: One or more OPLOCK_LEVEL_CACHE_XXX values that indicate the level of the oplock that was broken.
For possible values, see the RequestedOplockLevel member of the structure.

One or more OPLOCK_LEVEL_CACHE_XXX values that indicate the level to which an oplock is being broken, or an oplock level that may be available for granting, depending on the operation returning this buffer.
For possible values, see the RequestedOplockLevel member of the structure.

listheader.description: Indicates that an acknowledgment is required, and the oplock described in OriginalOplockLevel will continue to remain in force until the break is successfully acknowledged.
Indicates that the ShareMode and AccessMode members contain the share and access flags, respectively, of the request causing the oplock break. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: REQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_BUFFER.AccessMode
member.summary: If the REQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_FLAG_MODES_PROVIDED flag is set and theOPLOCK_LEVEL_CACHE_HANDLE level is being lost in an oplock break, contains the access mode mode of the request that is causing the break.

member.name: REQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_BUFFER.ShareMode
member.summary: If the REQUEST_OPLOCK_OUTPUT_FLAG_MODES_PROVIDED flag is set and theOPLOCK_LEVEL_CACHE_HANDLE level is being lost in an oplock break, contains the share mode of the request that is causing the break.
